incident_summary: Payment service outage due to SSL certificate expiration.
impact_scope: All online transactions failed for EU customers.
root_cause: Expired SSL certificate not renewed in CI/CD pipeline.
resolution_steps: Renewed certificate, redeployed service, updated pipeline to check expiry automatically.
preventive_actions: Add SSL expiry validation job before deployment.
automation_suggestion: Create CertExpiryAgent GPT workflow for pre-deployment checks.

incident_summary:
Application is not able to login. During verification, we found that the GetKey API is returning a 500.3 error. 
Further investigation revealed that on one of the application servers (IP: .36), the WebAPI is not working.
impact_scope: ALL Users
root_cause: duplicate entry in the webapi server
resolution_steps: removed the duplicatge entry and applicaition found working fine
preventive_actions: Need to make sure no duplicate entry

root_cause: connectivety between web and app server got failed using the telnet and found port got disable

incident_summary: wallet limit is increasing for some users

incident_summary:
The Equitas Bank team reported that duplicate transactions were 
posted to CBS on 31st- January 2025 leading to potential financial 
discrepancies. Incident occurence history. User's reported issues on below timings.
 
1.	December 2, 2024 3:26 PM IST
 
2.	December 23, 2024 2:46 PM IST
 
3.	December 30, 2024 10:23 AM IST
 
4.	January 2, 2025 10:00 AM IST.
impact_scope:
leading to potential financial 
discrepancies in CBS System
root_cause:
1. Analysis of the Production Log Files: 
Objective: Analyze the log files related to the reported issue. 
Findings:  
 The investigation revealed that transactions were 
successfully sent to the Equitas CBS system. 
 However, data was not stored correctly in the 
ENCollect CBS table post 10:15 PM when the 
maximum concurrency setting was increased to handle 
high load data more efficiently. 
2. Analysis of the Reconciliation Query: 
Objective: Analyze the reconcile query. 
Findings:  
 The investigation revealed that the reconciliation query 
produced false data due to partial data storage in the 
ENCollect CBS table after 10:15 PM. 
 This partial data storage was unknown to the Equitas 
Bank Production Support team, leading them to 
reinitiate the transactions to push them to the Equitas 
Bank CBS system again, causing duplicates. 
3. Analysis of the Code for Partial Data Storage: 
Objective: Investigate whether increased concurrency 
settings impacted data storage. 
. 
Findings:  
 At high concurrency, database transactions were not 
completing within the expected timeframe, leading to 
partial commits. 
 This resulted in a mismatch when the reconciliation 
query was executed. 
 Code improvements have been identified to ensure all 
transactions commit fully before being considered for 
reconciliation.
resolution_steps:
.Removal of Duplicate Transactions in Equitas CBS 
 Action: Equitas team removed the duplicate transactions from 
Equitas CBS. 
 Responsibility: Equitas Bank 
 Status: Completed 
 Verification Status: Verified by Equitas Bank
preventive_actions:
1. Fixing the Data Reconciliation Query 
 Action: The ENTiger team has corrected the data 
reconciliation query to ensure accurate data processing, even 
when the maximum concurrency value is increased. 
 Responsibility: Equitas Bank and ENTiger 
 Status: Completed 
 Verification Status: Verified by Equitas Bank 
2. Code Optimization for High Concurrency 
 Action: The ENTiger team is optimizing the code to support 
an increased max concurrency value to avoid partial data 
storage in the ENCollect CBS table. 
 Responsibility: Equitas Bank and ENTiger 
 Status: Work In Progress (WIP) 
 Verification Status: To be verified upon completion
automation_suggestion: No

incident_summary: Disparity in account details
impact_scope: Disparity in account details
root_cause: In Region State City master apis  the input parameter was not as expected by backend.
resolution_steps: We need to update the master apis  for geography and provide the corrected input parameters to get the desired result.
preventive_actions: Thorough testing of the modules being released in UAT prior production deployment.
automation_suggestion: No

incident_summary:
primary and 
secondary allocations were not functioning as expected.
impact_scope:
The primary and secondary allocations were processing 
slowly due to a heavy accumulation of data in the allocation's 
intermediate tables. This slowness led end users to believe that the 
allocations were not functioning.
root_cause:
To determine the root cause, two key areas were investigated: 
1. Existence of the Issue in UAT: 
Objective: Verify if the issue is present in the UAT 
environment. 
Findings: The issue was confirmed to be absent in the UAT 
environment, indicating that the problem was isolated to the 
production environment. 
2. Analysis of the Issue in Production: 
Objective: Identify the cause of the failure in the production 
environment. 
Findings:  
1. A significant accumulation of data was observed in the 
allocations intermediate tables. 
2. Duplicate records were causing errors in the SSIS 
package, preventing it from reaching the truncate 
command for clearing the intermediate tables. 
3. Since resolving this issue required extensive changes 
across SSIS packages and considering that the 
upcoming DBS ENCollect upgrade (to be delivered to 
DBS) already addresses this issue, a temporary 
housekeeping cleanup job was implemented.
resolution_steps:
Truncated Allocations Intermediate Tables: 
 Action: he DBS Bank production support team 
truncated the data in all allocations intermediate 
tables. 
 Responsibility: DBS Bank and ENTiger 
 Status: Completed in PROD 
 Verification Status: Completed.
preventive_actions:
Housekeeping Data Cleanup Job: 
 Action: The ENTiger team created a data cleanup job in 
the DBS UAT environment on 8th January 2025, but it 
was not moved to production. 
 Responsibility: DBS Bank and ENTiger 
 Status: Completed in UAT. 
 Verification Status: Yet to be validated by the DBS 
team in UAT.
automation_suggestion: No

incident_summary: Pan India bank staff users are not able to login in En-Collect
impact_scope: All Users
root_cause: IIS application pool auto reset which will refresh automatically for every 12 hours of interval is having issue with LDAP connectivity during its last refresh. Auth log Size is full
resolution_steps:
The issue is resolved with the restart of IIS services, now all users can login into the application.
Permanent Fix: We need to schedule IIS restarts every week to avoid this issue.Auth Flex log generation on a daily basis
preventive_actions: We need to schedule IIS restarts every week to avoid this issue
automation_suggestion: No

incident_summary: Upstream dependency degraded causing increased failures and retries. Observed after v3.2.1 in EU.
impact_scope: Partial failures; slow transactions; increased error rates. Metric: p95 latency 1200ms.
root_cause: Vendor incident / rate limiting; our retry policy too aggressive.
resolution_steps: Enabled circuit breaker; reduced retry; used fallback; contacted vendor support.
preventive_actions: Tune retries; add vendor SLO monitoring; implement bulkhead isolation.
automation_suggestion: DependencyWatch agent to detect upstream degradation and auto-adjust retries.
logs_or_errors: Upstream timeout calling vendor API after 10s

incident_summary: Login failures after configuration change; token validation mismatch. Observed after v3.3.0 in APAC.
impact_scope: All or subset of users unable to login; elevated 401/403. Metric: 5xx spike 22%.
root_cause: Misconfigured OAuth client settings / wrong JWKS URL / rotated keys not synced.
resolution_steps: Rolled back config; synced keys; corrected client settings; reissued tokens.
preventive_actions: Config change review; canary validation; contract tests for auth flows.
automation_suggestion: AuthConfigLint agent to validate OAuth/JWT config and run canary login tests.

incident_summary: Service unreachable due to DNS misconfiguration / load balancer target group drift. Observed after v3.3.0 in IN.
impact_scope: Users unable to access the application; 502/504 at edge. Metric: memory 95%.
root_cause: DNS record change not propagated / LB target group missing new nodes after deploy.
resolution_steps: Reverted DNS; refreshed LB targets; validated health checks; cleared caches.
preventive_actions: Change freeze guardrails; DNS validation pipeline; automated LB target reconciliation.
automation_suggestion: NetRouteAgent to validate DNS/LB changes pre-merge; auto-run synthetic checks.

incident_summary: Degraded performance due to CPU/memory saturation and pod eviction. Observed after v3.3.2 in MEA.
impact_scope: High latency and dropped requests; background jobs delayed. Metric: p95 latency 1200ms.
root_cause: Under-provisioned resources + sudden batch load; limits too low for peak hours.
resolution_steps: Scaled replicas; increased resource limits; paused batch jobs; rebalanced nodes.
preventive_actions: Right-size resources; HPA tuning; schedule batch windows; add saturation alerts.
logs_or_errors: OOMKilled: Container killed due to out of memory

incident_summary: Service outage due to SSL certificate expiration during rolling deployment. Observed after v3.3.2 in IN.
impact_scope: TLS handshake failures; customers unable to complete login/transactions. Metric: error rate 18%.
root_cause: Certificate rotation/validation step missing in CI/CD; expired cert deployed.
resolution_steps: Renewed/rotated certificate, reloaded ingress/gateway, validated handshake.
preventive_actions: Add automated cert-expiry checks and pre-deploy validation; alert 30 days prior.
automation_suggestion: CertExpiryAgent to scan cert stores + CI gates; auto-create change tickets.

incident_summary: Increased latency and intermittent 500 errors due to exhausted DB connection pool. Observed after v4.0.0 in IN.
impact_scope: Requests time out; partial outages for read/write paths. Metric: p95 latency 1200ms.
root_cause: Traffic spike + leak in connection handling after latest release; pool size too small.
resolution_steps: Hotfix to close connections; increased pool; scaled DB; restarted affected pods.
preventive_actions: Load test; connection leak detection; set SLO alerts on pool utilization.
automation_suggestion: DBPoolGuard agent to detect leaks via metrics and suggest safe pool tuning.
logs_or_errors: HikariPool-1 - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30000ms

incident_summary: Upstream dependency degraded causing increased failures and retries. Observed after v3.3.2 in EU.
impact_scope: Partial failures; slow transactions; increased error rates. Metric: CPU 92%.

impact_scope: Requests time out; partial outages for read/write paths. Metric: 5xx spike 22%.
root_cause: Traffic spike + leak in connection handling after latest release; pool size too small.
resolution_steps: Hotfix to close connections; increased pool; scaled DB; restarted affected pods.
preventive_actions: Load test; connection leak detection; set SLO alerts on pool utilization.
logs_or_errors: HikariPool-1 - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30000ms

incident_summary: Login failures after configuration change; token validation mismatch. Observed after v4.0.0 in MEA.
impact_scope: All or subset of users unable to login; elevated 401/403. Metric: p95 latency 1200ms.
root_cause: Misconfigured OAuth client settings / wrong JWKS URL / rotated keys not synced.
resolution_steps: Rolled back config; synced keys; corrected client settings; reissued tokens.
preventive_actions: Config change review; canary validation; contract tests for auth flows.
automation_suggestion: AuthConfigLint agent to validate OAuth/JWT config and run canary login tests.

incident_summary: Upstream dependency degraded causing increased failures and retries. Observed after v4.0.0 in US.
impact_scope: Partial failures; slow transactions; increased error rates. Metric: memory 95%.
root_cause: Vendor incident / rate limiting; our retry policy too aggressive.
resolution_steps: Enabled circuit breaker; reduced retry; used fallback; contacted vendor support.
preventive_actions: Tune retries; add vendor SLO monitoring; implement bulkhead isolation.
